title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum
Support

· In treatment II the tip is removed and the plant no longer bends toward light.

· In treatment III the cap blocks the light to the tip and the plant no longer bends toward light.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the following points.

Support

· In treatment II the tip is removed and the plant no longer bends toward light.

· In treatment III the cap blocks the light to the tip and the plant no longer bends toward light.

Student response earns one of the following points.

Support

· In treatment II the tip is removed and the plant no longer bends toward light.

· In treatment III the cap blocks the light to the tip and the plant no longer bends toward light.

Student response earns two of the following points.

Support

· In treatment II the tip is removed and the plant no longer bends toward light.

· In treatment III the cap blocks the light to the tip and the plant no longer bends toward light.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum

Description

· Tip produces a substance/signal/hormone (auxin) in response to light causing the plants to bend

· Substance must diffuse from the tip causing the plants to bend
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the following points.

Description

· Tip produces a substance/signal/hormone (auxin) in response to light causing the plants to bend

· Substance must diffuse from the tip causing the plants to bend

Student response earns one of the following points.

Description

· Tip produces a substance/signal/hormone (auxin) in response to light causing the plants to bend

· Substance must diffuse from the tip causing the plants to bend

Student response earns two of the following points.

Description

· Tip produces a substance/signal/hormone (auxin) in response to light causing the plants to bend

· Substance must diffuse from the tip causing the plants to bend
